headline: The AI Bubble Is Here. Why You Can Still Play the Stocks.
summary: Seaport Global analyst Jay  Goldberg is firmly in the bubble camp.  While chips are a critical part of the AI chain, he’s not sure that the business cycles are synced: “So saying that ASML,  Applied Materials Lam Research  and  KLA  are AI stories is a bit of stretch, but AI is definitely one of many important drivers of their business.”

raw.headline: The AI Bubble Is Here. Why You Can Still Play the Stocks.

headline: Supermicro Stock Is Gaining Steam. Can the Rally Continue?
summary: SMCI’s rebound comes after a post-earnings slump, when slowing sales momentum briefly cooled investors’ enthusiasm for one of the market’s favorite AI hardware plays.

headline: Dell Boosts Long-Term Guidance. The Stock Is Rising.
summary: Dell Technologies  stock was rising Tuesday after the company boosted its long-term financial guidance, citing demand for artificial-intelligence infrastructure.  The company is targeting annual revenue growth of 7% to 9%, up from a previous range of 3% to 4%.  Its adjusted per-share earnings growth target was boosted to 15% or better, almost double its prior forecast of 8%.

headline: Has Super Micro Run Too Far After Surging 35% in the Past Month?
summary: Wondering what to do with Super Micro Computer stock right now? You are not alone. The company has become the talk of the investing world after a run of returns that would make almost anyone sit up and take notice. Over just the last week, the stock jumped 17.8%, and it is up 35.2% for the past month. If you have been holding on longer, the numbers are even more eye-popping, with gains of 81.8% so far this year and an incredible 1856.3% over the past five years. Even the most level-headed...
